variable.description: The REC_FASTREPLICATION parameter specifies whether the RECOVER utility should use FlashCopy to recover from a FlashCopy image copy.

variable.name: REFSHAGE
variable.label: REFSHAGE
variable.description: The REFSHAGE subsystem parameter specifies the default value for the CURRENT REFRESH AGE special register. The default value is used when no value is explicitly set by using the SET CURRENT REFRESH AGE statement.

variable.name: RESLIB
variable.label: RESLIB
variable.description: The IMS RESLIB field identifies the data set name of the IMS linkage editor library that is to be used by sample and installation jobs.

variable.name: RESRECFD
variable.label: RESRECFD
variable.description: The RESTORE_ RECOVER_FROMDUMP subsystem parameter controls whether the system-level backup for the RESTORE SYSTEM and the RECOVER utilities is to occur from the dump on tape.

variable.name: RESTORTU
variable.label: RESTORTU
variable.description: When the RESTORE SYSTEM utility restores a system-level backup that has been dumped to tape, it allocates a number of tape units or tape drives. The RESTORE_TAPEUNITS subsystem parameter specifies the maximum number of tape units or tape drives that the RESTORE SYSTEM utility can allocate.

variable.name: RESYNC
variable.label: RESYNC
variable.description: A resynchronization period is the time during which indoubt logical units of work that involve this DB2 subsystem and partner logical units are processed. The RESYNC subsystem parameter specifies the time interval, in minutes, that is to occur between resynchronization periods.

variable.name: RESYNPRT
variable.label: RESYNPRT
variable.description: The value of the RESYNC PORT field specifies the TCP/IP port number that is to be used to process requests for two-phase commit resynchronization.

variable.name: RETLWAIT
variable.label: RETLWAIT
variable.description: When another DB2 subsystem in a data sharing group has failed, it can hold an incompatible lock on a resource. Locks that are held by failed DB2 members are called retained locks. The RETLWAIT subsystem parameter is used to calculate how long a transaction is to wait for a retained lock.

variable.name: REVDPRIV
variable.label: REVDPRIV
variable.description: The REVOKE_DEP_PRIVILEGES subsystem parameter controls whether revoking a privilege from a user is to cause dependent privileges to be revoked. If dependent privileges are to be revoked, revoking a privilege from a user also revokes the privilege from anyone that the user has granted that privilege to.

variable.name: RGFCOLID
variable.label: RGFCOLID
variable.description: The RGFCOLID subsystem parameter specifies the ID that is to own both the application registration table and the object registration table.

variable.name: RGFDBNAM
variable.label: RGFDBNAM
variable.description: The RGFDBNAM subsystem parameter specifies the name of the database that is to contain the registration tables that are used for data definition control support.

variable.name: RGFDEDPL
variable.label: RGFDEDPL
variable.description: The RGFDEDPL subsystem parameter specifies whether the DB2 subsystem is to be completely controlled by a set of closed applications that are identified in the application registration table.

variable.name: RGFDEFLT
variable.label: RGFDEFLT
variable.description: The RGFDEFLT subsystem parameter specifies the action that is to be taken for DDL statements that name unregistered objects.

variable.name: RGFESCP
variable.label: RGFESCP
variable.description: The RGFESCP subsystem parameter specifies the escape character that is to be used in the application registration table (ART) or object registration table (ORT).

variable.name: RGFFULLQ
variable.label: RGFFULLQ
variable.description: The RGFFULLQ subsystem parameter specifies whether registered objects are to require fully qualified names.

variable.name: RGFINSTL
variable.label: RGFINSTL
variable.description: The RGFINSTL subsystem parameter determines whether data definition control support is to be installed.

variable.name: RGFNMORT
variable.label: RGFNMORT
variable.description: The RGFNMORT subsystem parameter specifies the name that is to be used for the object registration table (ORT).

variable.name: RGFNMPRT
variable.label: RGFNMPRT
variable.description: The RGFNMPRT subsystem parameter specifies the name that is to be used for the application registration table.

variable.name: RIDPOOL
variable.label: RIDPOOL
variable.description: The MAXRBLK subsystem parameter specifies the amount of storage in kilobytes that is needed for the RID pool.

variable.name: RLFERRD
variable.label: RLFERRD
variable.description: The RLFERRD subsystem parameter specifies the action that DB2 takes for dynamic SQL statements from remote locations if the resource limit facility encounters a condition that prevents it from accessing the resource limit specification table. This setting also applies if DB2 cannot find an applicable row in the resource limit specification table. This parameter applies to the distributed data facility.

variable.name: RLFERRDS
variable.label: RLFERRDS
variable.description: The RLFERRDSTC subsystem parameter specifies the action that DB2 takes for static SQL statements from remote locations when a problem occurs with the resource limit specification table.

variable.name: RLFERROR
variable.label: RLFERROR
variable.description: The RLFERRD subsystem parameter specifies the action that DB2 takes for dynamic SQL statements from remote locations if the resource limit facility encounters a condition that prevents it from accessing the resource limit specification table. This setting also applies if DB2 cannot find an applicable row in the resource limit specification table. This parameter applies to the distributed data facility.

variable.name: RLFERRST
variable.label: RLFERRST
variable.description: The RLFERRSTC subsystem parameter specifies the action that DB2 takes when a problem occurs with the resource limit specification table during execution of a local, static SQL statement.

variable.name: RLFSCOPE
variable.label: RLFSCOPE
variable.description: The RLFENABLE subsystem parameter specifies whether the resource limit facility limits resources that are used by dynamic SQL statements only, static SQL statement only, or all SQL statements.

variable.name: RLFSTART
variable.label: RLFSTART
variable.description: The RLF subsystem parameter specifies whether the resource limit facility (governor) is to automatically start each time DB2 is started.

variable.name: RLFSUFF
variable.label: RLFSUFF
variable.description: The RLFTBL subsystem parameter specifies the suffix that is to be used for the default resource limit specification table (RLST). The default RLST is used when the resource limit facility (governor) is automatically started or when the governor is started without a specified suffix.

variable.name: RLPR
variable.label: RLPR
variable.description: The REORG_LIST_PROCESSING subsystem parameter specifies the default setting for the PARALLEL option of the DB2 REORG TABLESPACE utility.

variable.name: RMDB
variable.label: RMDB
variable.description: The REORG_MAPPING_DATABASE subsystem parameter specifies the default database that REORG TABLESPACE SHRLEVEL CHANGE uses to implicitly create the mapping table.

variable.name: RPBG
variable.label: RPBG
variable.description: The REORG_DROP_PBG_PARTS subsystem parameter specifies whether the REORG utility removes trailing empty partitions when operating on an entire partition-by-growth table space. An empty trailing partition occurs when the REORG utility moves all data records from a partition into lower numbered partitions.

variable.name: RPSN
variable.label: RPSN
variable.description: The REORG_PART_SORT_NPSI subsystem parameter specifies whether the REORG TABLESPACE PART utility decides to sort all of the keys of a non-partitioned secondary index. The setting is ignored for a REORG that is not part-level or without non-partitioned secondary indexes.

variable.name: RRULOCK
variable.label: RRULOCK
variable.description: When operations use repeatable read (RR) or read stability (RS) isolation levels to access a table, a specified locking method is used. The RRULOCK subsystem parameter specifies whether DB2 is to use U (UPDATE) locks or S (SHARE) locks.

variable.name: RSMAX
variable.label: RSMAX
variable.description: Specifies the maximum GB of real and auxiliary storage that DB2 can consume. Valid values are NOLIMIT and 1 to 65535.

variable.name: RSMGMT
variable.label: RSMGMT
variable.description: The REALSTORAGE_MANAGEMENT subsystem parameter specifies whether DB2 should manage real storage consumption.

variable.name: RSO
variable.label: RSO
variable.description: The RSO variable specifies whether DB2 immediately rejects requests for a stopped object or rechecks whether the object is started, up to the IRLM timeout limit.

variable.name: RUNLIB
variable.label: RUNLIB
variable.description: The value of the APPLICATION LOAD field specifies the name of the DB2 sample application load module library.

variable.name: S32KNOTS
variable.label: S32KNOTS
variable.description: The value of the 32K SORT WORK TS'S field specifies the number of 32 KB sort work file table spaces that are to be created.

variable.name: S32KSGSZ
variable.label: S32KSGSZ
variable.description: The value of the 32K SORT WORK SEG SIZE field specifies the segment size that is to be used for 32 KB sort work file table spaces. The value must be a multiple of 4 between 4 and 64, inclusive.

variable.name: S32KTSSZ
variable.label: S32KTSSZ
variable.description: The value of the 32K SORT PRIMARY SPACE SIZE field specifies the total amount of space for all 32 KB sort work table spaces in the work file database. This value is specified in MB but you can enter the value in GB by specifying a suffix of G, for example 1024G.

variable.name: S4KNOTS
variable.label: S4KNOTS
variable.description: The value of the 4K SORT WORK TS'S field specifies the number of 4 KB sort work file table spaces that are to be created.

variable.name: S4KSGSZ
variable.label: S4KSGSZ
variable.description: The value of the 4K SORT WORK SEG SIZE field specifies the segment size that is to be used for 4 KB sort work file table spaces. The value must be a multiple of 4 between 4 and 64, inclusive.

variable.name: S4KTSSZ
variable.label: S4KTSSZ
variable.description: The value of the 4K SORT PRIMARY SPACE SIZE field specifies the total amount of space for all 4 KB sort work table spaces in the work file database. This value is specified in MB but you can enter the value in GB by specifying a suffix of G, for example 1024G.

variable.name: SCCSID
variable.label: SCCSID
variable.description: The value of the EBCDIC CCSID field specifies the default CCSID for EBCDIC-encoded character data that is stored in your DB2 subsystem or data sharing system.

variable.name: SECADM1T
variable.label: SECADM1T
variable.description: The SECADM1_TYPE subsystem parameter specifies whether the entry in the SECURITY ADMIN 1 field is an authorization ID or a role.

variable.name: SECADM2T
variable.label: SECADM2T
variable.description: The SECADM2_TYPE subsystem parameter specifies whether the entry in the SECURITY ADMIN 2 field is an authorization ID or a role.

variable.name: SECADMN1
variable.label: SECADMN1
variable.description: The SECADM1 subsystem parameter specifies the first of two authorization IDs or roles that are to have DB2 security administrator authority. In the SEC ADMIN 1 TYPE field, specify whether this entry is an authorization ID or a role.

variable.name: SECADMN2
variable.label: SECADMN2
variable.description: The SECADM2 subsystem parameter specifies the second of two authorization IDs or roles that are to have DB2 security administrator authority. In the SEC ADMIN 2 TYPE field, specify whether this entry is an authorization ID or a role.

variable.name: SECDEFID
variable.label: SECDEFID
variable.description: The value of the SEC DEF CREATOR field specifies the CURRENT SQLID setting that is to be used when creating and configuring DB2-supplied routines that are defined with the SECURITY DEFINER option.

variable.name: SECPORT
variable.label: SECPORT
variable.description: The value of the SECURE PORT field specifies the TCP/IP port number that is to be used for accepting secure TCP/IP connection requests from remote DRDA clients and REST services.

variable.name: SEPSECUR
variable.label: SEPSECUR
variable.description: The SEPARATE_SECURITY subsystem parameter specifies whether DB2 security administrator duties are to be separated from system administrator duties for this subsystem.

variable.name: SFBS
variable.label: SFBS
variable.description: The STATFDBK_SCOPE subsystem parameter specifies the scope of the SQL statements that DB2 collects statistics recommendations for in the SYSIBM.SYSSTATFEEDBACK catalog table.

variable.name: SFPR
variable.label: SFPR
variable.description: The STATFDBK_PROFILE subsystem parameter specifies whether statistics recommendations identified during query optimization directly result in modifications to statistics profiles.

variable.name: SHSD
variable.label: SHSD
variable.description: Specifies whether DB2 suppresses SQLCODE +394 and SQLCODE +395 when specified access paths are applied for dynamic SQL statements. Valid values of SUPPRESS_HINT_SQLCODE_DYN are NO, STMT, and ALL.

variable.name: SIGNOMOD
variable.label: SIGNOMOD
variable.description: The value of this field specifies the member name of the load module that is to be used for the DB2 sign-on exit routine.

variable.name: SIMCCNT
variable.label: SIMCCNT
variable.description: Specifies the number of CPUs that are being simulated. This parameter is to be used for DB2 optimization modeling only.

variable.name: SIMCSPD
variable.label: SIMCSPD
variable.description: Specifies the microseconds of execution time for tasks or service request blocks (SRBs) per service unit for the CPU that is being simulated. This parameter is to be used for DB2 optimization modeling only.

variable.name: SITETYP
variable.label: SITETYP
variable.description: The SITETYP subsystem parameter specifies whether the current system is at a local site or a recovery site.

variable.name: SJTABLES
variable.label: SJTABLES
variable.description: Specifies when DB2 is to enable star join processing.

variable.name: SKIPUNCI
variable.label: SKIPUNCI
variable.description: The SKIPUNCI subsystem parameter specifies whether statements ignore a row that was inserted by another transaction if the row has not yet been detected as committed. A newly inserted row can be detected as committed only after the lock held on the row has been released.

variable.name: SMF89
variable.label: SMF89
variable.description: Specifies whether DB2 is to do detailed tracking for measured usage pricing. If you select YES, DB2 does detailed measured usage tracking if SMF type 89 records are activated. When SMF89 is set to YES, DB2 invokes a z/OS service on every entry into or exit out of DB2 to ensure accurate tracking.

variable.name: SMFCOMP
variable.label: SMFCOMP
variable.description: The SMFCOMP subsystem parameter specifies whether DB2 is to compress trace records that are to be written to SMF.

variable.name: SORTLIB
variable.label: SORTLIB
variable.description: The SORT LIBRARY field specifies the name of the data set where the DFSORT load module resides.

variable.name: SPCLOG
variable.label: SPCLOG
variable.abstract: THE ACTIVE LOG DATA SET SPACE
variable.description: The space of the active log data sets

variable.name: SPT01INL
variable.label: SPT01INL
variable.description: The SPT01_INLINE_LENGTH subsystem parameter specifies the maximum length of LOB column data in the SPT01 directory table space that is to be maintained in the base table. The length is specified in single-byte characters.

variable.name: SQLL
variable.label: SQLLEVEL
variable.description: Specifies the DB2 function level to be used by the precompiler and coprocessor in the absence of the SQLLEVEL option. This parameter is not used by the DB2 subsystem

variable.name: SRCLIB
variable.label: SRCLIB
variable.description: The value of the DECLARATION LIBRARY field specifies the name of the DB2 declaration library that is to be used for sample application include files.

variable.name: SRTPOOL
variable.label: SRTPOOL
variable.description: The SRTPOOL subsystem parameter specifies the amount of storage in kilobytes that is needed for the sort pool.

variable.name: STARJOIN
variable.label: STARJOIN
variable.description: The STARJOIN subsystem parameter specifies whether star join processing is to be enabled.

variable.name: STACS
variable.label: STACS
variable.abstract: STATISTICS COLGROUP DATA SORT STG LIMIT
variable.description: The STATCLGSRT parameter specifies how SORT is to be used by the RUNSTATS utility or by an inline statistics job when collecting statistics on a single column that is defined with the COLGROUP option.

variable.name: STATHIST
variable.label: STATHIST
variable.description: The STATHIST subsystem parameter specifies which inserts and updates are to be recorded in catalog history tables.

variable.name: STATROLL
variable.label: STATROLL
variable.description: The STATROLL subsystem parameter specifies whether the RUNSTATS utility is to aggregate the partition-level statistics, even though some parts might not contain data.

variable.name: STATSINT
variable.label: STATSINT
variable.description: The STATSINT subsystem parameter specifies the interval, in minutes, at which DB2 writes in-memory page set statistics to the real-time statistics tables. The value of the STATSINT subsystem parameter also controls the interval for writing statistics recommendations to the SYSIBM.SYSSTATSFEEDBACK catalog table. DB2 waits the specified number of minutes after the completion of the previous operation to begin the next operation.

variable.name: STGIJRT
variable.label: STGIJRT
variable.description: The STGIJRT field specifies the name of the STOGROUP for indexes created by DSNTRIN in DSNTIJRT job.

variable.name: STOGJRT
variable.label: STOGJRT
variable.description: The STOGJRT field specifies the name of the STOGROUP for databases and table spaces created by DSNTRIN in DSNTIJRT job.

variable.name: STORCLS2
variable.label: STORCLS2
variable.description: The values of the NON-VSAM DATA field specify the storage management properties for non-VSAM data. Specifically, the NON-VSAM DATA field applies to the prefix.DBRMLIB.DATA, prefix.RUNLIB.LOAD, and prefix.SRCLIB.DATA data sets.

variable.name: STORCLS3
variable.label: STORCLS3
variable.abstract: VSAM CATALOG, DEFAULT AND WORK FILE DATABASE
variable.description: The values in the VSAM CATALOG, DEFAULT AND WORK FILE DATABASE field specify storage management properties. These properties apply to temporary data sets, the default storage group and sample storage group, and the VSAM catalog.

variable.name: STORCLS6
variable.label: STORCLS6
variable.description: When installing DB2, you can change the values of the LOG COPY 1, BSDS 2 field. Specify the storage management properties for the first copy of the active log data set and the second copy of the bootstrap data set (BSDS).

variable.name: STORCLS7
variable.label: STORCLS7
variable.description: When installing DB2, you can change the values of the LOG COPY 2, BSDS 1 field. Use this field to specify the storage management properties for the second copy of the active log and the first copy of the BSDS.

variable.name: STORMXAB
variable.label: STORMXAB
variable.description: The STORMXAB subsystem parameter specifies the number of times a stored procedure or an invocation of a user-defined function is to be allowed to terminate abnormally. If this threshold is reached, SQL CALL statements for the stored procedure or user-defined function are rejected.

variable.name: STORTCBS
variable.label: STORTCBS
variable.description: The NUMBER OF TCBS field determines the number of SQL CALL statements and invocations of user-defined functions that can be processed concurrently in the address space of the default WLM environment. The default WLM environment is specified in the WLM ENVIRONMENT field.

variable.name: STORTIME
variable.label: STORTIME
variable.description: The STORTIME subsystem parameter specifies the number of seconds before DB2 is to stop waiting for an SQL CALL statement or invocation of a user-defined function. This parameter applies to user-defined functions that are to be assigned to one of the task control blocks (TCBs) in a DB2 stored procedures address space.

variable.name: STORWLM
variable.label: STORWLM
variable.description: The value of the WLM PROC NAME field specifies a name for the stored procedures JCL procedure that is to be generated during installation. This JCL procedure is generated for the default WLM environment that is specified in the WLM ENVIRONMENT field.

variable.name: SUBQMIDX
variable.label: SUBQMIDX
variable.description: Specifies whether to enable or disable multiple index access on some non-Boolean uncorrelated subquery predicates.

variable.name: SUPERRS
variable.label: SUPERRS
variable.description: The SUPERRS subsystem parameter specifies whether DB2 is to record errors such as invalid decimal data and arithmetic exceptions and issue SQLCODEs for them. This option enables or disables the recording of these errors in the operating system data set, SYS1.LOGREC.

variable.name: SVOLARC
variable.label: SVOLARC
variable.description: When archiving to disk, DB2 uses the number of online storage volumes for the specified UNIT name to determine a count of candidate volumes, up to 15. The SVOLARC subsystem parameter specifies whether DB2 is to use a single volume for disk archives.

variable.name: SYNCVAL
variable.label: SYNCVAL
variable.description: The SYNCVAL subsystem parameter specifies whether DB2 statistics recording is to be synchronized with some part of the hour, such as 15 minutes past the hour.

variable.name: SYSLVLBK
variable.label: SYSLVLBK
variable.description: The RECOVER utility uses image copies and concurrent copies for object-level recoveries. The SYSTEM_LEVEL_BACKUPS subsystem parameter specifies whether the RECOVER utility is to also use system-level backups as a recovery base for object-level recoveries.

variable.name: T32KDSSZ
variable.label: T32KDSSZ
variable.abstract: DSSIZE OF 32K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES
variable.description: The value of the DSSIZE OF 32K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES field specifies the data set size of 32 KB temporary work file table spaces.

variable.name: T32KMXPT
variable.label: T32KMXPT
variable.abstract: MAXPART OF 32K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES
variable.description: The value of the MAXPART OF 32K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES field specifies the maximum number of 32 KB temporary work file table space partitions.

variable.name: T32KNOTS
variable.label: T32KNOTS
variable.abstract: NUMBER OF 32K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES
variable.description: The value of the NUMBER OF 32K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES field specifies the number of 32 KB temporary work file table spaces.

variable.name: T32KSGSZ
variable.label: T32KSGSZ
variable.description: The value of the 32K TEMP WORK SEG SIZE field specifies the segment size that is to be used for 32 KB temporary work file table spaces. The value must be a multiple of 4 between 4 and 64, inclusive.

variable.name: T32KTSSZ
variable.label: T32KTSSZ
variable.description: The value of the 32K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACE SIZE field specifies the table space size of 32 KB temporary work file.

variable.name: T4KDSSZ
variable.label: T4KDSSZ
variable.abstract: DSSIZE OF 4K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES
variable.description: The value of the DSSIZE OF 4K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES field specifies the data set size of 4 KB temporary work file table spaces.

variable.name: T4KMXPT
variable.label: T4KMXPT
variable.abstract: MAXPART OF 4K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES
variable.description: The value of the MAXPART OF 4K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES field specifies the maximum number of 4 KB temporary work file table space partitions.

variable.name: T4KNOTS
variable.label: T4KNOTS
variable.abstract: NUMBER OF 4K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES
variable.description: The value of the NUMBER OF 4K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACES field specifies the number of 4 KB temporary work file table spaces.

variable.name: T4KSGSZ
variable.label: T4KSGSZ
variable.description: The value of the 4K TEMP WORK SEG SIZE field specifies the segment size that is to be used for 4 KB temporary work file table spaces. The value must be a multiple of 4 between 4 and 64, inclusive.

variable.name: T4KTSSZ
variable.label: T4KTSSZ
variable.description: The value of the 4K TEMP WORK TABLE SPACE SIZE field specifies the table space size of 4 KB temporary work file.

variable.name: TBSBP16K
variable.label: TBSBP16K
variable.abstract: DEFAULT 16-KB BUFFER POOL FOR USER DATA
variable.description: The TBSBP16K subsystem parameter specifies the default buffer pool to use for 16 KB page size table spaces that are created implicitly.

variable.name: TBSBP32K
variable.label: TBSBP32K
variable.abstract: DEFAULT 32-KB BUFFER POOL FOR USER DATA
variable.description: The TBSBP32K subsystem parameter specifies the default buffer pool to use for 32 KB page size table spaces that are created implicitly.

variable.name: TBSBP8K
variable.label: TBSBP8K
variable.abstract: DEFAULT 8-KB BUFFER POOL FOR USER DATA
variable.description: The TBSBP8K subsystem parameter specifies the default buffer pool to use for 8 KB page size table spaces that are created implicitly.

variable.name: TBSBPLOB
variable.label: TBSBPLOB
variable.abstract: DEFAULT BUFFER POOL FOR USER LOB DATA
variable.description: The TBSBPLOB subsystem parameter specifies the default buffer pool that is to be used for LOB table spaces that are created implicitly. This parameter also applies to LOB tables spaces that are created explicitly without the BUFFERPOOL clause.

variable.name: TBSBPOOL
variable.label: TBSBPOOL
variable.abstract: DEFAULT 4-KB BUFFER POOL FOR USER DATA
variable.description: The TBSBPOOL subsystem parameter specifies the default buffer pool to use for 4 KB page size table spaces that are created implicitly.

variable.name: TBSBPXML
variable.label: TBSBPXML
variable.abstract: DEFAULT BUFFER POOL FOR USER XML DATA
variable.description: The TBSBPXML subsystem parameter specifies the default buffer pool that is to be used for XML table spaces that are created implicitly.

variable.name: TCPALVER
variable.label: TCPALVER
variable.description: The TCPALVER subsystem parameter specifies whether DB2 is to accept TCP/IP connection requests that contain only a user ID (no password, RACF PassTicket, or Kerberos ticket). Or, this parameter specifies if a stronger form of security is required. This parameter is not relevant to trusted context users that have been switched.

variable.name: TCPKPALV
variable.label: TCPKPALV
variable.description: The TCPKPALV subsystem parameter determines whether the TCP/IP KeepAlive value in the TCP/IP configuration is to be overridden with a different value. This option can be used in cases where the TCP/IP KeepAlive value in the TCP/IP configuration is not appropriate for the DB2 subsystem.

variable.name: TPTM
variable.label: TPTM
variable.description: The TEMPLATE_TIME subsystem parameter specifies the default setting for the TIME option of the TEMPLATE statement.

variable.name: TRKRSITE
variable.label: TRKRSITE
variable.description: The value of the TRKRSITE subsystem parameter indicates whether the subsystem that is being installed is to be used as a remote tracker site. A remote tracker site is used by another DB2 subsystem in case of a disaster.

variable.name: TSQTY
variable.label: TSQTY
variable.description: The TSQTY subsystem parameter specifies the amount of space in KB that is to be allocated for primary and secondary spaces. This parameter applies to DB2-defined data sets for table spaces that are created without the PRIQTY and SECQTY clauses.

variable.name: TVOLDEVT
variable.label: TVOLDEVT
variable.description: The value of the TEMPORARY UNIT NAME field specifies the device type or unit name that is to be used for allocating temporary data sets.

variable.name: TWOBSDS
variable.label: TWOBSDS
variable.description: The TWOBSDS subsystem parameter specifies whether two BSDS data sets are used. A second BSDS (strongly recommended) makes recovery much easier in most situations. In cases that normally require recovery and restart, a second BSDS allows you to continue working. The storage overhead required is small and the data set is relatively inactive.

variable.name: UDBSG
variable.label: UDBSG
variable.description: The UTIL_DBBSG subsystem parameter specifies the name of a backup SMS storage group to be used by the BACKUP SYSTEM utility for the database copy pool. Set this field to a non-blank value only if the value of the ALTERNATE_CP parameter is also non-blank.

variable.name: UGCCSID
variable.label: UGCCSID
variable.description: The value of the UNICODE CCSID field specifies the CCSID that is to be used for Unicode data.

variable.name: UHMDH
variable.label: UHMDH
variable.description: The UTILS_HSM_MSGDS_HLQ subsystem parameter specifies the high-level qualifier for data sets to be allocated by the DB2 BACKUP SYSTEM and RESTORE SYSTEM utilities in order to receive messages from IBM Hierarchical Storage Management (HSM) and IBM Data Facility Data Set Services (DFDSS). These messages will be included for diagnostic purposes in DB2 utility SYSPRINT DD output.

variable.name: UIFCIDS
variable.label: UIFCIDS
variable.description: The UIFCIDS subsystem parameter specifies whether output from IFC records is to include Unicode information.

variable.name: ULBSG
variable.label: ULBSG
variable.description: The UTIL_LGBSG subsystem parameter specifies the name of a backup SMS storage group to be used by the BACKUP SYSTEM utility for the log copy pool. Set this field to a non-blank value only if the value of the ALTERNATE_CP parameter is also non-blank.

variable.name: UMCCSID
variable.label: UMCCSID
variable.description: The value of the UNICODE CCSID field specifies the CCSID that is to be used for Unicode data.

variable.name: UMD
variable.label: UMD
variable.description: The PARAMDEG_UTIL subsystem parameter specifies the maximum number of parallel subtasks for some utilities.

variable.name: URCHKTH
variable.label: URCHKTH
variable.description: Unless the option is disabled, DB2 issues a warning message to the console for an uncommitted unit of recovery (UR) after a certain number of checkpoint cycles. The URCHKTH subsystem parameter specifies the number of checkpoint cycles that are to complete before DB2 issues the warning message.

variable.name: URLGWTH
variable.label: URLGWTH
variable.description: Unless this option is disabled, DB2 issues a warning message to the console after log records are written by an uncommitted unit of recovery (UR). The URLGWTH subsystem parameter specifies the number of log records that are to be written before DB2 issues a warning message.

variable.name: USCCSID
variable.label: USCCSID
variable.description: The value of the UNICODE CCSID field specifies the CCSID that is to be used for Unicode data.

variable.name: UTDUMPCL
variable.label: UTDUMPCL
variable.description: A system-level backup can occur from a dump on tape or from a disk copy. For backups that occur from the dump on tape, the UTILS_DUMP_CLASS_NAME subsystem parameter specifies the name of the DFSMShsm dump class that is to be used.

variable.name: UTIMOUT
variable.label: UTIMOUT
variable.description: The UTIMOUT subsystem parameter specifies how long, in number of resource values, that a utility or utility command is to wait for a resource. The utility or utility command waits until a lock or all claims on a resource of a particular claim class is released.

variable.name: UTOC
variable.label: UTOC
variable.description: The value of the UTILITY_OBJECT_CONVERSION parameter specifies whether DB2 utilities that accept the RBALRSN_CONVERSION option will convert existing table spaces and indexes to 6-byte page format, to a 10-byte page format, or perform no conversion.

variable.name: UTTEMPSC
variable.label: UTTEMPSC
variable.description: The UTIL_TEMP_STORCLAS subsystem parameter specifies the storage class that the CHECK INDEX, CHECK DATA, and CHECK LOB utilities are to use when allocating temporary shadow data sets. (These utilities allocate shadow data sets when you specify the SHRLEVEL CHANGE option.)

variable.name: VBSDSLOG
variable.label: VBSDSLOG
variable.abstract: BSDS AND ACTIVE LOG ICF CATALOG ALIAS
variable.description: The value of the BSDS AND ACTIVE LOG ICF CATALOG ALIAS field specifies a dedicated ICF catalog and alias for DB2 BSDS and active log data sets. The value can be the same as the value of VCATALOG, the ICF catalog and alias for DB2 catalog and directory data sets, but it's recommended to use a different value to facilitate DB2 backup and recovery. This field also specifies the high-level qualifier for BSDS and active log data sets.

variable.name: VCATALOG
variable.label: VCATALOG
variable.description: The value of the CATALOG ALIAS field specifies the high-level qualifier for VSAM data sets that are to be used by the DB2 catalog and directory.

variable.name: VOLSDAT2
variable.label: VOLSDAT2
variable.description: The values of the NON-VSAM DATA field specify the storage management properties for non-VSAM data. Specifically, the NON-VSAM DATA field applies to the prefix.DBRMLIB.DATA, prefix.RUNLIB.LOAD, and prefix.SRCLIB.DATA data sets.

variable.name: VOLSDAT3
variable.label: VOLSDAT3
variable.abstract: VSAM CATALOG, DEFAULT AND WORK FILE DATABASE
variable.description: The values in the VSAM CATALOG, DEFAULT AND WORK FILE DATABASE field specify storage management properties. These properties apply to temporary data sets, the default storage group and sample storage group, and the VSAM catalog.

variable.name: VOLSDAT6
variable.label: VOLSDAT6
variable.description: When installing DB2, you can change the values of the LOG COPY 1, BSDS 2 field. Specify the storage management properties for the first copy of the active log data set and the second copy of the bootstrap data set (BSDS).

variable.name: VOLSDAT7
variable.label: VOLSDAT7
variable.description: When installing DB2, you can change the values of the LOG COPY 2, BSDS 1 field. Use this field to specify the storage management properties for the second copy of the active log and the first copy of the BSDS.

variable.name: VOLSDEVT
variable.label: VOLSDEVT
variable.description: The PERMANENT UNIT NAME field specifies the device type or unit name that is to be used for allocating data sets that are created during installation or migration.

variable.name: VOLTDEVT
variable.label: VOLTDEVT
variable.description: The VOLTDEVT subsystem parameter specifies the device type or unit name that is to be used by the DB2 COPY CONCURRENT and CHECK utilities for dynamically allocating temporary data sets. Specifying a value for VOLTDEVT removes the need to specify the FILTERDDN DD in the utility job.

variable.name: WFDBSEP
variable.label: WFDBSEP
variable.description: The WFDBSEP subsystem parameter specifies whether DB2 should provide an unconditional separation of table spaces in the work file database based on the allocation attributes of the table spaces.

variable.name: WFSAT
variable.label: WFSAT
variable.description: The WFSTGUSE_AGENT_THRESHOLD subsystem parameter determines the percentage of available space in the work file database on a DB2 subsystem or data sharing member that can be consumed by a single agent before a warning message is issued.

variable.name: WFSST
variable.label: WFSST
variable.description: The WFSTGUSE_SYSTEM_THRESHOLD subsystem parameter determines the percentage of available space in the work file database on a DB2 subsystem or data sharing member that can be consumed by all agents before a warning message is issued.

variable.name: WLMENV
variable.label: WLMENV
variable.description: The WLMENV subsystem parameter specifies the name of the default WLM_ENVIRONMENT that is to be used for a user-defined function or stored procedure. This environment is used when a value is not specified for the WLM_ENVIRONMENT option on the CREATE FUNCTION or CREATE PROCEDURE statements.

variable.name: WLMENV1
variable.label: WLMENV1
variable.description: The value of the FOR SERIALIZED ROUTINES field identifies the WLM environment that is to be used for DB2-supplied routines that need to run serially. A routine that must run serially cannot share a task control block with another routine.

variable.name: WLMENVC
variable.label: WLMENVC
variable.description: The value of the FOR THE DB2 CICS ROUTINE field identifies the WLM environment that is to be used for the DB2 CICS transaction processor routine SYSPROC.DSNACICS.

variable.name: WLMENVD
variable.label: WLMENVD
variable.description: The FOR UNIFIED DEBUGGER ROUTINES field identifies the WLM environment that is to be used for DB2-supplied routines that are for the unified debugger tool.

variable.name: WLMENVG
variable.label: WLMENVG
variable.description: The value of the FOR MOST DB2 ROUTINES field identifies the WLM environment that is to be used for running most DB2-supplied routines.

variable.name: WLMENVJ
variable.label: WLMENVJ
variable.description: The value of the FOR MOST DB2 JAVA ROUTINES field identifies the WLM environment that is to be used for running most DB2-supplied Java routines.

variable.name: WLMENVM
variable.label: WLMENVM
variable.description: The value of the FOR DB2 MQSERIES ROUTINES field specifies the name of the WLM environment that is to be used for DB2 MQSeries functions.

variable.name: WLMENVP
variable.label: WLMENVP
variable.abstract: FOR ROUTINES IDENTIFIED TO PROGRAM CONTROL
variable.description: The FOR ROUTINES IDENTIFIED TO PROGRAM CONTROL field identifies the WLM environment that is to be used for running DB2-supplied routines that require program control. These routines can be registered to RACF or an equivalent product.

variable.name: WLMENVR
variable.label: WLMENVR
variable.description: The value of the FOR DB2 REXX ROUTINES field identifies the name of the WLM environment that is to be used for DB2-supplied REXX routines.

variable.name: WLMENVU
variable.label: WLMENVU
variable.description: The value of the FOR DB2 UTILITIES ROUTINES field identifies the name of the WLM environment that is to be used for running the DB2-supplied routines for utilities. This WLM environment should be used only by the SYSPROC.DSNUTILS and SYSPROC.DSNUTILU stored procedures.

variable.name: WLMENVW
variable.label: WLMENVW
variable.description: The value of the FOR DB2 WEB SERVICES ROUTINES field identifies the WLM environment that is to be used for DB2 web services functions.

variable.name: WLMENVX
variable.label: WLMENVX
variable.description: The value of the FOR DB2 XML PROCESSING ROUTINES field identifies the WLM environment that is to be used for running most DB2-supplied XML processing routines. This applies to the XSR_ADDSCHEMADOC, XSR_REGISTER, and XSR_REMOVE routines.

variable.name: XLKUPDLT
variable.label: XLKUPDLT
variable.description: The XLKUPDLT subsystem parameter specifies the locking method that is to be used when DB2 executes a searched update or delete.

variable.name: XPKE
variable.label: XPKE
variable.description: The IX_TB_PART_CONV_EXCLUDE subsystem parameter specifies whether to exclude trailing columns from the table-controlled partitioning keys when table spaces are converted from index-controlled partitioning to table-controlled partitioning.

variable.name: XRDI
variable.label: XRDI
variable.description: Specifies whether DB2 is to sequentially or randomly generate the DOCID values for XML columns.

variable.name: ZOSMETRI
variable.label: ZOSMETRI
variable.description: Enables DB2 to gather z/OS metrics, including CPU usage and storage metrics, by using the z/OS Resource Measurement Facility (RMF) interface. Valid values are YES and NO.

variable.name: ENKL
variable.label: ENKL
variable.description: Specifies the name of a ICSF key label to pass when using DFSMS access method encryption support to define encrypted data sets for the DB2 catalog, directory, and archive logs.

variable.name: SQLINTRP
variable.label: SQLINTRP
variable.description: IBM Serviceability. Do not change without IBM guidance.

variable.name: MXOPTSTO
variable.label: MXOPTSTO
variable.description: IBM Serviceability. Do not change without IBM guidance.

variable.name: MXTBJOIN
variable.label: MXTBJOIN
variable.description: IBM Serviceability. Do not change without IBM guidance.

variable.name: OPTXQB
variable.label: OPTXQB
variable.description: IBM Serviceability. Do not change without IBM guidance.

variable.name: SECA1IS
variable.label: SECA1IS
variable.description: Specifies whether the SECADM1 setting is passed as a hexadecimal string or as a standard character string. Valid values are HEX or CHAR.

variable.name: SECA2IS
variable.label: SECA2IS
variable.description: Specifies whether the SECADM2 setting is passed as a hexadecimal string or as a standard character string. Valid values are HEX or CHAR.

variable.name: UNCOLN7
variable.label: UNCOLN7
variable.description: Specifies what behavior DB2 uses for result column names in UNION queries. Valid values are NO and YES. The default is NO.

variable.name: AGSSIDPX
variable.label: AGSSIDPX
variable.description: The value of the COMMAND PREFIX AUTOGEN field used to generate automated command prefix

variable.name: AGEXECID
variable.label: AGEXECID
variable.abstract: User ID used to execute the provisioning workflow
variable.description: The value of this variable is the user ID used to execute the provisioning workflow

variable.name: AGICHLQ
variable.label: AGICHLQ
variable.description: This HLQ will be combined by the subsystem name concatenade with constant CP1 to build IC data set name, when in provision mode (SSNCP1.*).

variable.name: AUTOGEN
variable.label: AUTOGEN
variable.description: Choice to automated provisioning

variable.name: AGNEWIDS
variable.label: AGNEWIDS
variable.description: The value of this variable is to be used to build the name of data set or library that contains a customized copy of one or more members of a DB2 target library, during automated provisioning.

variable.name: DSNPFPE
variable.label: DSNPFPE
variable.description: SDSNPFPE

variable.name: DSNSPFM
variable.label: DSNSPFM
variable.description: SDSNSPFM

variable.name: DSNSPFP
variable.label: DSNSPFP
variable.description: SDSNSPFP

variable.name: DSNSPFS
variable.label: DSNSPFS
variable.description: SDSNSPFS

variable.name: DSNSPFT
variable.label: DSNSPFT
variable.description: SDSNSPFT

variable.name: JAVAHOME
variable.label: JAVAHOME
variable.description: The Z/OS SDK HOME DIR field specifies the absolute path of the HFS/zFS directory where the z/OS Java Software Development Kit (SDK) resides. This directory is provided by z/OS and is referenced by the JAVA_HOME variable in the file specified in the JAVA ENV VAR FILE field.

variable.name: CLASPATH
variable.label: CLASPATH
variable.description: The Z/OS USS JAVA CLASSES field specifies the absolute path of the HFS/zFS directory that contains jar files provided by z/OS Unix System Services (z/OS Unix). Verify that this directory contains the jar files gxljapi.jar (z/OS XML System Services XML schema registration) and IRRRacf.jar (Java interface to the system security product). This directory is provided by z/OS and is referenced by the CLASSPATH variable in the file specified in the JAVA ENV VAR FILE field.

variable.name: LIBPATH
variable.label: LIBPATH
variable.description: The Z/OS USS JAVA RUNTIME field specifies the absolute path of the HFS/zFS directory that contains the native library (DLLs) provided by z/OS Unix System Services (z/OS Unix). Verify that this directory contains libGXLNVBAT.so, the DLL for z/OS XML System Services. This directory is provided by z/OS and is referenced by the LIBPATH variable in the file specified in the JAVA ENV VAR FILE field.

variable.name: JCCHOME
variable.label: JCCHOME
variable.description: The JDBC/SQLJ ENV VAR DIR field specifies the absolute path of the highest-level directory in the set of HFS/zFS directories that contain the classes and other objects for the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ. This directory and its subdirectories are typically managed by SMP/E. It is referenced by the JCC_HOME variable in the file specified in the JAVA ENV VAR FILE field. Within the directory specified here, the subdirectories bin (contains the runtime objects for the IBM Data Server Driver for JDBC and SQLJ), classes (contain

variable.name: JCCSID
variable.label: JCCSID
variable.description: Serviceability

variable.name: DB2BASE
variable.label: DB2BASE
variable.description: The DB2 BASE JAVA DIR field specifies the absolute path of the highest-level directory in the set of HFS/zFS directories that contain the DB2 for z/OS-supplied Java classes, native methods (DLLs), and samples. This directory and its subdirectories are typically managed by SMP/E. It is referenced by the DB2_BASE variable in the file specified in the JAVA ENV VAR FILE field. Within the directory specified here, the subdirectories classes (contains the DB2 base-supplied jar files), lib (contains the DB2 base-supplied DLLs), and samples (

variable.name: JAVAENV
variable.label: JAVAENV
variable.description: The JAVA ENV DATA SET field specifies the name of the environment (JAVAENV) data set for the DB2-supplied Java WLM Java Environment, DSNWLM_JAVA. This data set is created by job DSNTIJMJ and must not already exist. It is allocated by the JAVAENV DD of DSNWLMJ, the address space startup procedure for DSNWLM_JAVA. DSNWLMJ is created by job DSNTIJMW. It contains the _CEE_ENVFILE environment variable which provides the name and location of the Java environment variable file to be used when the DSNWLM_JAVA environment is started.

variable.name: JAVAENVV
variable.label: JAVAENVV
variable.description: The JAVA ENV VAR FILE field specifies the absolute path and name of the HFS/zFS environment variable file for the DB2-supplied Java WLM environment, DSNWLM_JAVA. This file is created when you run installation job DSNTIJMJ and must not already exist. It is referenced in the _CEE_ENVFILE environment variable of the JAVAENV data set specified in the JAVA ENV DATA SET field.

variable.name: JVMPROPS
variable.label: JVMPROPS
variable.description: The JVM PROPERTIES FILE field specifies absolute path and name of the HFS/zFS Java Virtual Machine (JVM) startup options file used by the DB2-supplied Java WLM environment, DSNWLM_JAVA. This file is created when you run installation job DSNTIJMJ and must not already exist. It is referenced by the JVMPROPS variable in the file specified in the JAVA ENV VAR FILE field.

variable.name: JVMAMODE
variable.label: JVMAMODE
variable.description: The JVM ADDRESSING MODE field indicates whether DSNWLMJ, the address space proc for DSNWLM_JAVA, should be configured to request a 32-bit or a 64-bit JVM. When this field is set to 32, DSNTIJMW is configured to add DSNWLMJ with NUMTCB set to 5 and the started WLM module set to DSNX9WLM. When this field is set to 64, DSNTIJMW is configured to add DSNWLMJ with NUMTCB set to 25 and the started WLM module set to DSNX9WJM.

variable.name: JVMHEAP
variable.label: JVMHEAP
variable.description: The INIT JAVA HEAP SIZE indicates the size in megabytes of the initial Java heap (the middleware heap within non-system heap) for the JVM used by the DSNWLM_JAVA WLM environment. This value is assigned to the -Xms option in the JVM startup options file specified in the JVM PROPERTIES FILE field.

variable.name: JVMAPPH
variable.label: JVMAPPH
variable.description: The MAX APPL HEAP SIZE indicates the maximum size in megabytes of memory for application work (non-system heap) in the JVM used by the DSNWLM_JAVA WLM environment. This value is assigned to the -Xmx option in the JVM startup options file specified in the JVM PROPERTIES FILE field.

variable.name: AGTCPPID

step.name: stepJMA
step.title: Add DB2 address space startup JCL procedures (DSNTIJMA)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJMA adds the address space startup JCL procedures for DB2,
IRLM, and the administrative task scheduler to the system proclib.
step.instructions:
To add the address space startup JCL procedures for DB2, IRLM, and the
administrative task scheduler to the system proclib, run job DSNTIJMA. If it
runs successfully, it produces a return code of 0.

step.name: stepJMP
step.title: Add DB2 program preparation and utilities invocation JCL procs (DSNTIJMP)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJMP adds JCL procedures to the system proclib for use in DB2 application
program preparation and DB2 utility invocation.
step.instructions:
Run job DSNTIJMP to add JCL procedures to the system proclib for use in DB2
application program preparation and DB2 utility invocation. If the job runs
successfully, it produces a return code of 0.

step.name: stepJMW
step.title: Add address space JCL procs for the DB2-supplied WLM environments (DSNTIJMW)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJMW adds the JCL startup procedures for the DB2-supplied WLM environments
to the system proclib.
step.instructions:
To add the JCL startup procedures for the DB2-supplied WLM environments to the
system proclib, run job DSNTIJMW. If it runs successfully, it produces a
return code of 0.

step.name: stepJMJ
step.title: Add environment files for the DB2-supplied Java WLM environment (DSNTIJMJ)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJMJ creates the environment files for the DB2-supplied Java WLM
environment.
step.instructions:
To add the environment files for the DB2-supplied Java WLM environment,
DSNWLM_JAVA, run job DSNTIJMJ. If it runs successfully, it produces
return codes of 0.
Review the content of the data set created by job step DSNTIJJ.
* This data set is allocated by the JAVAENV DD of the address space
startup procedure for the DB2 core WLM environment for Java routines.
That address space proc is created by job DSNTIJMW.
* The _CEE_ENVFILE parameter needs to be set to the name and path of the
environment variable file created by job step DSNTIJR of job DSNTIJMJ.
Review the content of the file created by job step DSNTIJR.
* This file is specified by the _CEE_ENVFILE parameter of the data set
created by DSNTIJJ, the previous job step.
* It contains configuration settings for the DB2-supplied Java WLM
environment, DSNWLM_JAVA.
* Parameters:
* CLASSPATH: The class path that contain the jar file for z/OS XML
System Services XML schema registration (gxljapi.jar).
* DB2_BASE : The highest-level directory in the set of directories that
contain the DB2 for z/OS code
* JCC_HOME : The path where the JCC driver is located
* JAVA_HOME: The path where the JDK is located
* JVMPROPS : The path and name of the file that contains startup
options for the JVM. This file is created by the next
job step, DSNTIJS.
* LIBPATH : The path for the native library for z/OS XML System
Services (libGXLNVBAT.so)
* STEPLIB : The name of the DB2 for z/OS runtime library (SDSNLOAD)
Refer to the DB2 Programming for Java guide for a description of
the environment variables and other options in this file.
Review the content of the file created by job step DSNTIJS.
* This file is specified by the JVMPROPS parameter of the environment
variable file created by DSNTIJR, the previous job step.
* It contains optional JVM startup options for the DB2-supplied Java
WLM environment.
* The -Xms parameter sets the initial size of the middleware heap within
the non-system heap. Example: Xms64M
* The -Xmx parameter sets the maximum size of the non-system heap.
Example: -Xmx128M
* Lines that begin with a single "#" are commented-out JVM startup
startup options. To activate an option, delete the leading "#".

step.name: step4
step.title: Define system data sets(DSNTIJIN)
step.description: Use job DSNTIJIN to define the VSAM and non-VSAM data sets for DB2.
step.instructions:
To define system data sets:
1. Check the DEFINE CLUSTER statements in job DSNTIJIN to ensure that they
allocate adequate disk space for your system.
Recommendation: For recovery purposes, place system data sets such as the
DB2 recovery log and the VSAM catalog on different disk volumes. Because
these data sets are used frequently, do not migrate them by using DFSMShsm.
2. Run job DSNTIJIN.
If DSNTIJIN runs successfully, it produces return codes of 0 for all DEFINE
statements and steps. Check any VSAM messages carefully.
3. If job DSNTIJIN fails or abends, complete the following steps:
a. Remove the z/OS catalog delete statements from job DSNTIJDE.
b. Run job DSNTIJDE. This job deletes the previously created data sets for the
DB2 directory and DB2 catalog.
c. Run DSNTIJIN again.

step.name: step5
step.title: Define the DB2 subsystem parameter module(DSNTIJUZ)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJUZ generates the DB2 subsystem parameter (DSNZPxxx) module. The
subsystem parameter module is the name that was specified for the PARAMETER
MODULE field on installation panel DSNTIPO3.
step.instructions:
To define DB2 subsystem parameter (DSNZPxxx) module:
1. Verify that data sets that are allocated by the SYSLMOD DD statements of
this job are also allocated by the STEPLIB DD statements of the DSNMSTR
address space for DB2.
2. Insert the DSPREFIX value after SDSNLOAD.
3. Run job DSNTIJUZ.
If you want DSNTIJUZ to establish SMP/E GENASM entries for the DB2 system
parameter (DSN6xxxx) macros, you need to uncomment job step DSNTIMQ.
Advanced SMP/E skills are recommended for users of job step DSNTIMQ.
Read the job step prolog before proceeding. You might receive a return
code of 4 or message GIM65001 when you run step DSNTIMQ. You can ignore
these diagnostics.
4. If job DSNTIJUZ fails or abends, correct the problem and rerun the job.

step.name: step5a
step.title: Define the DB2 application defaults module(DSNTIJUA)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJUA generates the DB2 application defaults module. The application
defaults module is the name that was specified for the APPL DEFAULTS field
on installation panel DSNTIPO3.
step.instructions:
To define DB2 application defaults module:
1. Verify that data sets that are allocated by the SYSLMOD DD statements of
this job are also allocated by the STEPLIB DD statements of the DSNMSTR
address space for DB2.
2. If the DB2 distribution library prefix is different from the target library
prefix, edit DSNTIJUA to correct the data set name for prefix.ADSNLOAD.
3. If you have not run the SMP/E ACCEPT job (DSNACEP1) of FMID HDBCC10, edit
DSNTIJUA to include the SMP/E temporary data set (SMPTLIB) in the concatenation
for the ADSNLOAD DD statement in step DSNTIZQ. SMPTLIB is hlq.HDBCC10.F2, where
hlq is from the GLOBAL SMP/E zone. Use the following SMP/E statements to get
DSPREFIX:
SET BOUNDARY (GLOBAL).
LIST DDDEF ( SMPTLIB ).
4. Insert the DSPREFIX value after SDSNLOAD and ADSNLOAD.
5. Run job DSNTIJUA.
If you want DSNTIJUA to establish SMP/E GENASM entries for the DB2 application
defaults parameter (DSNHDECM) macro, you need to uncomment job step DSNTIMQ.
Advanced SMP/E skills are recommended for users of job step DSNTIMQ.
Read the job step prolog before proceeding. You might receive a return
code of 4 or message GIM65001 when you run step DSNTIMQ. You can ignore
these diagnostics.
6. If job DSNTIJUA fails or abends, correct the problem and rerun the job.

step.name: step5b
step.title: Define the DB2 offline message CCSIDs module(DSNTIJUM)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJUM generates the DB2 offline message CCSIDs module, DSNHMCID.
DSNHMCID is link-edited into both the prefix.SDSNEXIT and prefix.SDSNLOAD
libraries.
step.instructions:
To define DB2 offline message CCSIDs module:
1. Run job DSNTIJUM.
If you want DSNTIJUM to establish SMP/E GENASM entries for the DB2 offline
message CCSIDs (DSNHMCIM) macro, you need to uncomment job step DSNTIMQ.
Advanced SMP/E skills are recommended for users of job step DSNTIMQ.
Read the job step prolog before proceeding. You might receive a return
code of 4 or message GIM65001 when you run step DSNTIMQ. You can ignore
these diagnostics.
2. If job DSNTIJUM fails or abends, correct the problem and rerun the job.

step.name: step5c
step.title: Update DDF related information in the BSDS(DSNTIJUL)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJUL runs the DB2 change log inventory (DSNJU003) to update
DDF-related and data sharing-related information in the BSDS.
step.instructions:
To update DDF-related and data sharing-related information in the BSDS:
1. Before running job DSNTIJUL, examine the DSNJU003 utility control statement
carefully to ensure that the options are appropriate for your needs.
2. Run job DSNTIJUL. If job DSNTIJUL runs successfully, it produces return
code of 0.
3. If job DSNTIJUL fails, correct the problem and rerun the job.

step.name: step6a
step.title: Initialize system data sets - 1(DSNTIJID)
step.description:
After you define your system data sets and DB2 initialization parameters, you
must initialize your system data sets.
step.instructions:
To initialize system data sets:
Run jobs DSNTIJID, DSNTIJIE, and DSNTIJIF, in that order.
v If the jobs run successfully, they produce return codes of 0. Otherwise, check for
and resolve error conditions that might be reported by VSAM messages.
v If any of the jobs fail or abend, remove the ICF catalog delete statements (job
step DSNTIVC) from job DSNTIJDE, run job DSNTIJDE, and then rerun
DSNTIJIN, DSNTIJUZ, DSNTIJUA, DSNTIJUM, DSNTIJUL, DSNTIJID, DSNTIJIE, and DSNTIJIF.

step.name: step6b
step.title: Initialize system data sets - 2(DSNTIJIE)
step.description:
After you define your system data sets and DB2 initialization parameters, you
must initialize your system data sets.
step.instructions:
To initialize system data sets:
Run jobs DSNTIJID, DSNTIJIE, and DSNTIJIF, in that order.
v If the jobs run successfully, they produce return codes of 0. Otherwise, check for
and resolve error conditions that might be reported by VSAM messages.
v If any of the jobs fail or abend, remove the ICF catalog delete statements (job
step DSNTIVC) from job DSNTIJDE, run job DSNTIJDE, and then rerun
DSNTIJIN, DSNTIJUZ, DSNTIJUA, DSNTIJUM, DSNTIJUL, DSNTIJID, DSNTIJIE, and DSNTIJIF.

step.name: step6c
step.title: Initialize system data sets - 3(DSNTIJIF)
step.description:
After you define your system data sets and DB2 initialization parameters, you
must initialize your system data sets.
step.instructions:
To initialize system data sets:
Run jobs DSNTIJID, DSNTIJIE, and DSNTIJIF, in that order.
v If the jobs run successfully, they produce return codes of 0. Otherwise, check for
and resolve error conditions that might be reported by VSAM messages.
v If any of the jobs fail or abend, remove the ICF catalog delete statements (job
step DSNTIVC) from job DSNTIJDE, run job DSNTIJDE, and then rerun
DSNTIJIN, DSNTIJUZ, DSNTIJUA, DSNTIJUM, DSNTIJUL, DSNTIJID, DSNTIJIE, and DSNTIJIF.

step.name: step7
step.title: Define user authorization exit routines(DSNTIJEX)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJEX builds sample authorization exit routines from the source code in
prefix.SDSNSAMP. These sample authorization exit routines are DSN3@SGN and
DSN3@ATH, and the user version of the access control authorization exit routine,
DSNX@XAC.
step.instructions: Run job DSNTIJEX.

step.name: step10
step.title: Connect DB2 to TSO(DSNTIJVC)
step.description:
Access to TSO is required to support the interactive component of DB2 (DB2I).
Access to TSO also allows batch applications to access DB2 when those batch
programs are executed under the TSO terminal monitor program (TMP).
step.instructions:
To attach DB2 to TSO:
1. Make DB2 load modules available to TSO and batch users.
2. Make DB2 CLISTs available to TSO and batch users.
3. Make panels, messages, and load modules available to ISPF and TSO.

step.name: step14
step.title: Start the DB2 subsystem(DSNTIJSA)
step.description: During installation of DB2, start the DB2 subsystem after you IPL z/OS.
step.instructions:
To start DB2:
1. Start the IRLM, if you have not requested that DB2 automatically start the
IRLM. You must start IRLM before you start DB2.
Use the following command:
START irlmproc
where irlmproc is the name that you specified for the PROC NAME option on
IRLM Panel 1 (DSNTIPI).
If you specified YES for the AUTO START option on IRLM Panel 1 (DSNTIPI),
DB2 starts the IRLM automatically.
2. Start DB2 from the z/OS console. Use the following command:
-DSN1 START DB2
where (-DSN1) is the subsystem command prefix that you defined for DB2.

step.name: step15
step.title: Tailor the DB2 catalog(DSNTIJTC)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJTC invokes the CATMAINT utility to tailor your Version 11 catalog,
which you must do to fully install DB2. DSNTIJTC performs site-specific tailoring
of the catalog.
step.instructions:
Run job DSNTIJTC. You must ensure that the installation job runs on the same
z/OS system on which the appropriate DB2 subsystem is running.
A status message, DSNU777I, is issued at several points to indicate progress.
Diagnostic error messages are issued when CATMAINT processing fails. If a
problem is found during the SQL processing phase of installation, message
DSNU778I is issued. If non-supported functions are encountered, message
DSNU776I is issued. All of these messages are written to the SYSPRINT data set.
Because this is the first use of DB2, errors from earlier steps might be detected
here.

step.name: step15a
step.title: Activate a DB2 function level(DSNTIJAF)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJAF can be used to activate a specified DB2 function level.
The function level setting is specified in the DB2 FUNCTION LEVEL field on
installation panel DSNTIP00.
step.instructions:
When you install DB2 12, it starts up at function level V12R1M500. If you
specified a higher function level in the DB2 FUNCTION LEVEL field on
installation panel DSNTIP00, run DSNTIJAF after DSNTIJTC to activate that
function level.

step.name: step16
step.title: Create default stogroup, define temporary work files, and bind DB2 REXX Support(DSNTIJTM)
step.description:
You must create the default storage group that is for user-defined DB2 tables that
are not specifically assigned to a storage group. You must also define the database
that is for temporary work files, and bind DB2 REXX Language Support.
step.instructions:
To create the default storage group, define temporary work files, and bind DB2
REXX Language Support:
Run job DSNTIJTM.

step.name: step17
step.title: Define and bind DB2 objects(DSNTIJSG)
step.description:
Use job DSNTIJSG to bind DB2-supplied packages and plans, initialize the DB2
communications database, and create user-managed databases for the DB2 resource
limit facility (RLF), Data Definition Control support, and query optimization.
step.instructions:
To use job DSNTIJSG:
1. If you use a product that uses a semicolon as a delimiter, replace the
semicolons at the end of each SQL statement in job DSNTIJSG before you run
the job.
If you use a product that uses a semicolon as a delimiter, the CLIST adds SQL
statements to job DSNTIJSG. Products that use a semicolon as a delimiting
character cause semicolons to be removed from the installation CLIST before it
is executed.
2. Run job DSNTIJSG.
If the DSNTIJSG job runs successfully, it produces return codes of 0. It might
also produce a return code of 4 because a step within this job attempts to delete
a row from a table that might not exist at the time that this job runs. Expect the
following messages from the BIND statement for each object that DB2 provides:
DSNE932I WARNING, ONLY IBM-SUPPLIED PLAN NAMES SHOULD BEGIN WITH DSN
DSNE932I WARNING, ONLY IBM-SUPPLIED PACKAGE-IDS SHOULD BEGIN WITH DSN
DSNE932I WARNING, ONLY IBM-SUPPLIED COLLECTION-IDS SHOULD BEGIN WITH DSN
3. If the DSNTIJSG job fails or abends:
a. Be sure that the user that is specified on the JOB statement is authorized.
Use the same name that you specified for either the SYSTEM ADMIN 1
option or the SYSTEM ADMIN 2 option on installation panel DSNTIPP1.
b. Correct any other problems with the DSNTIJSG job, and run it again. If you
do not have enough resources to run the job, review the values that you
specified for the DB2 subsystem parameters. (See job DSNTIJUZ.) Use the
standard update procedure to make any necessary modifications. Then stop
DB2, run the DSNTIJUZ job, start DB2, and run the DSNTIJSG job again.

step.name: step20a
step.title: Setting up the DB2 core WLM environments during migration(DSNTIJRW)
step.description:
DB2 stored procedures (except native SQL procedures) must run in WLM-managed
stored procedure address spaces. You must assign each stored procedure to a WLM
application environment, which routes the stored procedure work to the
appropriate WLM-managed address space. If you completed this task when you
installed or migrated to Version 10, you do not need to complete this task again.
Continue your migration with the next step.
step.instructions:
Run job DSNTIJRW.
Job DSNTIJRW invokes the DSNTWLMB tool to create the core WLM
environments. The CLIST assigns the core WLM environment names in DSNTIJRW
according to the values that are specified on panel DSNTIPR1.;

step.name: step20b
step.title: Installing DB2-supplied routines during migration(DSNTIJRT)
step.description:
The DSNTIJRT and DSNTIJRV jobs install and validate the installation of
DB2-supplied routines. These jobs are configured with the options that you
specified on installation panel DSNTIPR1 and panels DSNTIPRA through
DSNTIPRP.
step.instructions:
To install the DB2-supplied routines:
1. Run job DSNTIJRT.
2. After DSNTIJRT successfully completes, run job DSNTIJRV to validate the
installation of the routines.
3. If these stored procedures were not used in Version 10, you must authorize the
appropriate users to use the stored procedures by issuing the GRANT
EXECUTE statement.
As part of the installation process, job DSNTIJRT defines, binds, and grants
access to the stored procedures and user-defined functions. Job DSNTIJRT
grants EXECUTE authority to the authorization IDs that are specified for the
GRANT EXECUTE fields on installation panels DSNTIPRB through DSNTIPRP.
The default setting for GRANT EXECUTE is PUBLIC, meaning that anyone
who can access DB2 can use these stored procedures.
Recommendation: When you run the installation CLIST, use the GRANT
EXECUTE fields on panels DSNTIPRB through DSNTIPRP to specify different
access lists.
4. Complete additional setup steps for any of the following routines that you plan
to begin using in Version 11.

step.name: step20c
step.title: Validate the installation of DB2-supplied routines(DSNTIJRV)
step.description:
Job DSNTIJRV validates the DB2-supplied routines by executing program
DSNTRVFY. You should validate these routines after DB2 installation and after
each phase of migration.
step.instructions: Run job DSNTIJRV.

step.name: step21
step.title: Back up the DB2 directory and catalog(DSNTIJIC)
step.description: For backup purposes, create a copy of the DB2 directory and catalog.
step.instructions:
To create an image copy of the directory and catalog:
1. Examine job DSNTIJIC for the following information:
v The tape unit name. The job lists the tape unit name as TAPE. If this is
incorrect for your site, correct it. The name TAPE is also the unit name for
the default archive log data sets.
* Expiration date or retention period. You can add a retention period or an
expiration date to the job.
* The user on the JOB statement. Ensure that the user is authorized. If DB2 is
started under ACCESS(MAINT), this must be the same user that you
specified for either the SYSTEM ADMIN 1 option or the SYSTEM ADMIN 2
option on installation panel DSNTIPP1.
2. Run job DSNTIJIC.
The DSNTIJIC job contains a list of all the DB2 directory and catalog table
spaces. When you run job DSNTIJIC, it invokes the DB2 image copy utility to
copy these table spaces to tape. Having copies of table spaces enables you to
recover the DB2 catalog and DB2 directory in case of a failure.
3. If the DSNTIJIC job fails or abends, verify that no problems exist with
the tape setup for image copy. If you find no problems with the tape setup, examine the
utility job output (JOBLOG) or the console log for problems. For example, look
for I/O errors or incorrect sizes.

step.name: step22b
step.title: Installation verification phase 1(DSNTEJ1)
step.description:
Creating and loading sample tables:
DSNTEJ1 invokes program DSNTIAD, which creates objects during the verification
procedure. Run DSNTIEJ1 before running any other sample jobs.
step.instructions:
Job DSNTEJ1 creates all objects that are to be used by the sample verification jobs.
Run this job before any other verification job.

step.name: step22c
step.title: Installation verification phase 1(DSNTEJ1L)
step.description:
Creating and loading sample tables:
DSNTEJ1L prepare and invoke program DSNTEP2, which lists the
contents of the sample tables.
step.instructions:
DSNTEJ1L link-edits the DSNTEP2 object deck (DSNTEP2L) to create an executable
load module DSNTEP2.
DSNTEJ1L link-edits the DSNTEP4 object deck (DSNTEP4L) to create an executable
load module DSNTEP4.
DSNTEJ1L also binds and runs programs DSNTEP2 and DSNTEP4. DSNTEP2 lists
the sample database tables and views. DSNTEP2 is a dynamic PL/I program that
accepts SQL statements. DSNTEP2 produces a listing of the results of SELECT
statements. DSNTEP4 is identical to DSNTEP2, except that it uses multi-row fetch.
Job DSNTEJ1L requires the Language Environment link-edit and run time libraries.
DSNTEJ1L does not require the PL/I compiler.

step.name: step22d
step.title: Installation verification phase 2(DSNTEJ2A)
step.description:
Testing the batch environment:
DSNTEJ2A tests the assembler program preparation procedures.
step.instructions:
DSNTEJ2A tests the assembler program preparation procedures.
This job prepares and invokes program DSNTIAUL, which demonstrates the use of
dynamic SQL in assembler to unload the data from tables or views. It also
generates LOAD utility statements so the data can be loaded into another table.
DSNTEJ2A then uses the LOAD utility to put data into copies of the unloaded
tables.

step.title: Create and Grant usage of Db2 Storage Group for User data (DSNTIJTU)
step.description: Create Db2 storage group for user data and grant its usage to PUBLIC.
step.instructions: Generated instruction text for step: stepJTU

step.instructions: In provisioning mode BP0 and SYSDEFLT storage group are used to create the RESTful services database
